title: How to Save in The Legend of Zelda Games

methods.name: Zelda II: The Adventure of Link

steps.headline: Insert two controllers into your console before you start the game.
Press Up and A on the second controller to bring up a screen with a "Save" option.
steps.description: Select this option to save the game. Alternatively, losing all three of your lives will bring up this screen.

methods.name: The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask

steps.headline: Play the Song of Time to go back to the first day and save your progress.
Hit an owl statue with your sword, and talk to it to save.
steps.description:
This save, however, is temporary, and will be lost once you reload the save file. text:
Zelda II: The Adventure of Link Insert two controllers into your console before you start the game. Press Up and A on the second controller to bring up a screen with a "Save" option. Select this option to save the game. Alternatively, losing all three of your lives will bring up this screen. The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask Play the Song of Time to go back to the first day and save your progress. Hit an owl statue with your sword, and talk to it to save. This save, however, is temporary, and will be lost once you reload the save file. In Majora's Mask 3D, the owl statues are now permanent saves and the Song of Time does not save anymore. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Save-in-The-Legend-of-Zelda-Games-Step-8.jpg\/v4-460px-Save-in-The-Legend-of-Zelda-Games-Step-8.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Save-in-The-Legend-of-Zelda-Games-Step-8.jpg\/aid5377845-v4-728px-Save-in-The-Legend-of-Zelda-Games-Step-8.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"
